CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;No violation of Art. 3;No violation of P4-4
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Jean-Paul Costa
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant comes from the NORP province of GPE and is a member of the NORP ethnic group . His family were land - owning farmers . His father was a member of ORG and was a party representative in ORG . After the fall of the communist regime of PERSON , this political involvement by a NORP was regarded as high treason . In particular , the applicant ’s family faced hostility from a former warlord who had gone on to become a prominent local figure , ORG . The latter , a NORP and a former member of PERSON ( an NORP political party ) , appropriated the family ’s possessions in DATE . At DATE a grenade was thrown into the applicant ’s family home , and he sustained injuries to the head and thigh . The applicant claimed to have scars on his body as a result of that event . His father allegedly received a knee injury . The case file included a medical certificate drawn up on DATE by a doctor at ORG at ORG , GPE , who concluded :

“ ... Mr PERSON informs me that he is from the GPE region . Following a conflict between his father and a local chief , a grenade was thrown at the family home . Mr PERSON states that he sustained injuries to the head and left thigh .
In the course of the examination , several scars on the left parietal area of the scalp and a scar covering CARDINAL of the outer left thigh were found .
The findings of the clinical examination are compatible with the patient ’s statements . ”
CARDINAL . The applicant and his family left GPE for GPE , staying first in ORG , then in NORP .

CARDINAL . The applicant claimed that he arrived in GPE in DATE . On DATE he applied for asylum . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , ORG ( “ the OFPRA ” ) refused his application on the following grounds :

“ The applicant , who was questioned at the ORG , referred to land disputes between his father and a local commander and stated that he had been obliged to leave his country of origin in DATE or DATE . He initially lived in a camp on the NORP - NORP border for DATE before settling with his family in GPE .

Even supposing they were substantiated , and given the grounds having occasioned them , the time that has elapsed and the political changes that have since occurred in GPE , the circumstances described can not , however , justify the applicant ’s refusal to return and to claim protection from the current authorities in his country of origin . ”
CARDINAL . NORP That decision was upheld on CARDINAL May CARDINAL by ORG . On DATE the applicant was directed to leave NORP territory .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant ’s family was repatriated from GPE to their village of origin . They again encountered hostility from ORG who , supported by the new governor of GPE ( also a member of a radical NORP party and , like PERSON , an ethnic NORP ) , refused to return their land . According to the applicant , his family were again obliged to seek refuge in the NORP town of NORP . The applicant alleged that he had heard nothing from his relatives since that time .

CARDINAL . In the light of those events , the applicant alleged that he had intended to lodge a fresh application for asylum in GPE , but that he had been waiting to obtain further news from his family .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested at FAC in GPE , a place where NORP nationals newly arrived in GPE frequently gathered . He was released on that occasion .

CARDINAL . On DATE he was again arrested at the same location with other NORP nationals . He alleged that the NORP police had carried out targeted arrests based on the nationality of those concerned , with a view to organising a “ grouped flight ” to deport them .
CARDINAL . On DATE he was made the subject of a prefectoral removal order , of a decision stipulating the country of destination and of an administrative detention order .

CARDINAL . The applicant applied to ORG to have set aside the prefectoral order of DATE and the separate decision naming GPE as the country of destination . By a judgment of DATE , the judge appointed by the President of ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request . The applicant appealed to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE , during a hearing with the liberties and detention judge at the GPE tribunal de grande instance , the applicant stated : “ I do not wish to return to my country of origin because I am afraid for my life . I have new information to include in my request for political asylum . I would like to see a doctor . ”
CARDINAL . In an order issued on DATE , the liberties and detention judge ordered that the administrative detention be extended by DATE , until TIME on DATE . The judge also noted :
“ the detainee raised complaints of a medical nature ... and requested political asylum ; ...
We order that the detainee be examined by a doctor from the forensic medicine unit at ORG in order to determine whether his state of health is compatible with the detention and expulsion order . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and CARDINAL other NORP nationals ( PERSON , PERSON and NORP ) lodged an application with the ORG , together with a request for application of Rule CARDINAL of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE Police Commissioner ’s Office informed the applicant that he had been refused leave to remain , in a document dated DATE and worded as follows :
“ You were arrested on DATE and found to be in contravention of the legislation on aliens ; you have now requested that your application for asylum be re - examined .
This request , submitted out of time and in support of your [ continued ] detention , is clearly intended to circumvent an order for removal from NORP territory .

In consequence , and in accordance with Articles L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL , L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL of the LAW on the conditions of entry and residence of aliens and the right of asylum , I refuse to grant you leave to remain . ...

The re - examination of your request for refugee status will therefore be given priority treatment by ORG under Articles L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL , PERSON , L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL , L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL , L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL , L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL , L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL of the above - mentioned Code .

Finally , an administrative measure of expulsion by prefectoral order may be taken in application of Articles L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL and L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL of the above - mentioned Code ; however , this may not be enforced prior to the ORG ’s decision ( Article PERSON of the above - mentioned Code ) . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the acting President of the Second Section decided to indicate to ORG , under LAW , that it was desirable to refrain from deporting the applicant to GPE . He also invited the Government to keep the ORG informed of the applicant ’s situation with regard to the proceedings on his asylum application and the medical examination ordered by the liberties and detention judge . In reply , the Government indicated that the applicant had been released from ORG on DATE and was free to circulate on NORP territory .
CARDINAL . On DATE a grouped flight left GPE for GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG decided to extend the interim measure indicated under Rule CARDINAL until further notice .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prefecture summoned the applicant to an interview , scheduled for DATE , to examine his administrative situation with a view to enforcement of the removal measure .
CARDINAL . On DATE the OFPRA registered a second asylum application from the applicant . On DATE the Director General of the OFPRA refused it on the following grounds :
“ In support of his application ,
Mr PERSON
Refers to the general situation in GPE .

In itself , however , this evidence is not sufficient to substantiate the fears of persecution or the existence of serious threats within the meaning of Articles PERSON and L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL of the LAW on the conditions of entry and residence of aliens and the right of asylum . Accordingly , it is not admissible .
He submits a statement from an association for refugees .
This , however , is a new item of evidence which refers to events that were previously argued . Accordingly , it is not admissible .

He further claims that his family has again been persecuted by the henchmen of ORG , an influential local military leader in the GPE region , since their return to the NORP territory . It is claimed that a cousin is currently being detained .

However , the applicant ’s statements , which are brief and vague , are not supported by any credible or decisive evidence capable of proving that the alleged facts are true and that his fears are well - founded . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against that decision to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicant submitted the additional information requested by the ORG and confirmed that he wished to pursue the application .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against ORG judgment of DATE . It found , inter alia :
“ On the lawfulness of the removal order :

... Firstly , contrary to what is alleged by Mr PERSON , the expulsion order dated DATE , which sets out the considerations of law and of fact on which it is based , is supported by sufficient grounds ; the prefect , who indicated that the appellant ’s situation had been scrutinised , particularly with regard to his right to family life , examined the appellant ’s personal situation ;

Secondly , the disputed removal order , the sole purpose of which is the removal from the territory of Mr PERSON , is not collective in nature ; in any event , it does not therefore contravene the requirements of LAW No . CARDINAL to LAW ... which prohibits collective expulsions ; nor can Mr PERSON validly rely either on the provisions of LAW ... , which are not applicable to appeal judgments against removal orders , or on the provisions of LAW No . CARDINAL to the said Convention , published by decree of CARDINAL DATE , which are applicable only to aliens residing lawfully on the territory of a ORG ;
On the lawfulness of the additional decision naming the country of destination :

Mr PERSON ’s request for political asylum has been ... refused by decisions of ORG and ORG ; his second request for asylum , submitted on DATE , was rejected by a new decision by ORG DATE ; although Mr PERSON refers to the risk that he would run in the event of a return to GPE , given the situation of civil war that exists in that country , that circumstance is not in itself capable of substantiating the risks alleged by the appellant in the event of return to his country of origin ; he has not submitted any evidence concerning his personal situation which would make it possible to consider as substantiated [ his argument ] that there are circumstances which would constitute a legal impediment to expulsion to his country of origin ; ... ”
